neighbors.name: Guy B. Tiner
neighbors.claims: Guy B. Tiner, born in 1951, is a 75-year-old Bonner Springs resident [National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/t/guy-tiner/). He founded **Guy Tiner Co.**, a home-building business in Bonner Springs, in 1983 [Manta](https://www.manta.com/c/mmnykv0/guy-tiner-co), and he remains active in local development via entities like **Tiner – 134th Street LLC** (registered under his name) [City-Data](https://www.city-data.com/business-entities/KS/TINER-134TH-STREET-LLC-7818883-KS.html).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have the project’s construction team highlight opportunities for local contractors, leveraging Tiner’s decades of homebuilding experience to build rapport.

neighbors.name: Richard S. Crystal & Martha E. Gonzalez
neighbors.claims: In 2020, Martha E. Gonzalez applied to acquire a Unified Government Land Bank lot in Kansas City, KS to build a facility for storing and servicing trucks [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/2020/12/page/28/). This suggests that she (and co-owner Richard S. Crystal) are involved in a local small trucking or maintenance business venture [Wyandotte Daily](https://wyandotteonline.com/2020/12/page/28/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Emphasize the project’s strong stormwater management plan to prevent any increased runoff or flooding, as this reassurance will likely resonate with their priorities.

neighbors.name: Daniel J. Poolman & Karen A. Poolman
neighbors.claims: Daniel J. Poolman and his wife Karen were married in 1966 and raised three children together in the community [Dignity Memorial](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/kansas-city-ks/karen-poolman-9194736). Karen Ann Poolman passed away in 2020 at age 72, leaving Daniel as the surviving property owner [Dignity Memorial](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/kansas-city-ks/karen-poolman-9194736).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime residents; no public leadership roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a neighborly, respectful approach through a familiar community member or local gathering, honoring their decades of local ties and family legacy in the area.

overview_summary: Of the three neighbors profiled, none have openly supported or opposed the development (all noted stances are unknown). Likewise, none hold high-profile community positions – no high-influence neighbors were identified among this group.
